summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 between FBI personnel discussing investigative updates on the Jeffrey Epstein case. It covers financial analysis progress, victim identification, property forfeiture, and coordination regarding co-conspirators, including one in London.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the financial and criminal investigation. His LLC companies were subpoenaed, and his properties are being appraised for forfeiture.

events.title: Appraisal of Epstein's NY Residence
events.description: A certified appraisal was completed for Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence, valuing it at $86,250,000.

events.title: Investigation Status Update
events.description: FBI provides an update on the Epstein investigation, including receipt of financial productions, victim interviews, and coordination with co-conspirators.

keyFacts: Approximately 60 victims have been identified, with potentially hundreds more unidentified; over 20 victims have been interviewed.
Victims reported sexual abuse at multiple residences including New York, Florida, Little St. James, and New Mexico.
A certified appraisal valued Epstein's New York residence at $86,250,000 as of July 13, 2019, and a notice of pendency was filed for it.
All co-conspirators were served except one residing in London; contact was made with London counterparts to arrange an interview.
Financial analysis included receiving productions from AMEX and Deutsche Bank, reviewing FinCEN filings (SARs/FBARs), and preparing an initial link diagram.
